etymologies: late Middle English: perhaps from an Anglo-Norman French alteration of Old French robe ‘spoils’; compare with rubbish

definitions: waste or rough fragments of stone, brick, concrete, etc., especially as the debris from the demolition of buildings

examples.text: two buildings collapsed, trapping scores of people in the rubble

shortDefinitions: waste or rough fragments of stone, brick, concrete, etc.

definitions: pieces of rough or undressed stone used in building walls, especially as filling for cavities

examples.text: the tower is built of stone rubble faced with ashlar

shortDefinitions: pieces of rough or undressed stone used in building walls
